availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Pennebaker Boone (Louisville attorney and soldier)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and soldier. Harrison County, Indiana, native. Son of Samuel Boone. Married to Eliza Rowan Harney Boone. Father of John R. Boone, Ann M. Boone, and Samuel Boone. Teacher in Harrison County, Indiana. County Clerk in Harrison County. Attorney in Harrison County. Attorney and partner in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, with P. Thomasson in Thomasson & Boone from 1836 to 1861. Owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Member of the Union Democratic State Central committee. Member of the Louisville Board of Aldermen. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Jefferson County in 1861. Served in the 28th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a lieutenant colonel and colonel from November 6, 1861 to June 27, 1864.
